did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, lecture notes, printed material, photographs, notebooks, ephemera.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence concerning the organization of biochemical research in Brazil, notes for addresses and lectures, drafts and reprints of articles, graphs, photographs, and slides, the Scheele medal (1929), the gold medal and certificate for the Nobel Prize in Chemistry, printed Nobel proceedings, photographs of the ceremony, glass slides made in the course of his research, photographs of fellow scientists, and his chemistry notebook from Harvard. Also, biographical sketches, notes, clippings, and related correspondence used by Professor Leonard A. Maynard in preparation of his memoir of Sumner.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of Biochemistry and Director of the Laboratory of Enzyme Chemistry at Cornell University.
Sumner won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1946 for the crystallizations of the enzyme urease.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning the organization of biochemical research in Brazil, notes for addresses and lectures, drafts and reprints of articles, graphs, photographs, and slides, the Scheele medal (1929), the gold medal and certificate for the Nobel Prize in Chemistry, printed Nobel proceedings, photographs of the ceremony, glass slides made in the course of his research, photographs of fellow scientists from Cornell and elsewhere, and his chemistry notebook from Harvard. Also, biographical sketches, notes, clippings, and related correspondence used by Professor Leonard A. Maynard in preparation of his memoir of Sumner, published in 1958 by the National Academy of Sciences.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: James B. Sumner papers, #29-2-671. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
